alert.note: Alert for Iron; Madison; Reynolds; St. Francois; Ste. Genevieve (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 02 at 10:29PM CDT until August 02 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Iron County in southeastern Missouri... Southern Ste. Genevieve County in southeastern Missouri... Northern Reynolds County in southeastern Missouri... Northwestern Madison County in southeastern Missouri... St. Francois County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1029 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of De Soto to near Potosi to 9 miles northeast of Courtois to near Cherryville to 9 miles north of Salem, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Farmington, Bonne Terre, Desloge, Fredericktown, Bismarck, Ironton, Leadwood, Park Hills, Pilot Knob, Iron Mountain Lake, Viburnum, Arcadia, Bunker, Junction City, Cobalt, Knob Lick, Iron Mountain, Weingarten, Glover, and Bixby. This also includes St. Joe State Park, St. Francois State Park, Johnsons Shut-Ins State Park, Hawn State Park, Fort Davidson Historic Site, Elephant Rocks State Park, Taum Sauk Mountain State Park, and Missouri Mines Historic Site. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Iron; Madison; Reynolds; St. Francois; Ste. Genevieve
